Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the impact of factoring in 10 years worth of tax revenue and only six and a half years worth of expenses on the cost savings of "Obamacare".
Understate: The claim may be understating the potential impact of factoring in 10 years worth of tax revenue and only six and a half years worth of expenses on the cost savings of "Obamacare".
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient supporting evidence to fully validate the statement made by President Obama and Nancy Pelosi.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that factoring in 10 years worth of tax revenue and only six and a half years worth of expenses would lead to cost savings in "Obamacare", without providing enough evidence to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the inclusion of 10 years worth of tax revenue and only six and a half years worth of expenses in the calculation of cost savings in "Obamacare" that are not mentioned in the claim.
